captions.text: weird animal government experiments
operation acoustic Kitty,  during the Cold War
the US was desperate to find new ways to spy on the soviets, somehow
the US government spent between 10 to 20 million dollars on turning household
cats into international spies
by planting a microphone in the ear canal, a small transmitter at the base of
the skull
and an antenna into the tail, it seem like they created the perfect
elite spy except for the fact that in the first test mission
the little guy was run over by a taxi almost immediately. two headed dogs
in 1954 Vladimir Demikhov  successfully took the head and forearms of a
puppy and grafted it to an adult
German Shepherd, I know that makes no sense but get this the two dogs slept and ate
at different times
even though the puppy received nourishment from the larger dog. what's
more is that Vladimir was able to recreate the experiment 20 more times
Now, before you go on and hate Vladimir for his mad scientist practices
these experiments were the first successful heart and lung transplants in
animals meeting Vladimir's work eventually lead to organ transplants
which saved countless lives. psychedelic elephants.
okay this was a real head-scratcher a group of researchers studying
aggression in mail elephants thought the right thing to do was to give 3000
times the level over human dose of LSD, wanna guess how it ended? well the
big guy fell to his knees and although they tried to revive him
the elephant died within minutes the conclusion, it appears that the elephant
is highly sensitive to the effects of LSD...
The Earmouse.  this little guy made headlines when the world saw it
hairless mouse with human-like-ear-thing growing out its back, some folks
protested saying his genetically engineered mutant was a crime against
humanity however there was no human DNA in the mouse and he wasn't actually
genetically engineered at all
instead the scientist created a biodegradable scaffold made from cow
cartilage cells
and implanted it under the skin at the mouse, so in time the mouse could replace
and support the ear-shaped cartilage
The point of the experiment was to figure out a way to replace lost or damaged ears
not to create some sort of
ear mouse mutant thing.  human/ape hybrid.
doctor Ilya Ivanov and his son secretly tried and failed thankfully to
impregnate a female chimp with human sperm
even though they had some backing from the Soviet Union Ivanov  knew that his plan was
super "F"-ed up
had to keep it a secret from pretty much everyone, after his plans failed the plan
was to get a human female volunteer
to carry the Human-zee baby, surprisingly he actually got a few
female volunteers that thankfully never got to see his dream come to life
for Stalin was not a fan of his and sent him to a  prison camp for about two years
putting a stop to his disturbing plans
*Chimpanzee noises*
